author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 32-year-old woman, C. Kalaivani, was killed and two others, including her 8-year-old son Mithun Roshan, sustained burn injuries in an accidental fire in the house in Usilampatti on Monday.

Police said that suspected leak from cooking gas cylinder led to the fire accident around 7 a.m. when the woman started preparations for cooking.

Roshan and a neighbour, E. Selvam (50), rushed to her help, but they also sustained burns.

All the three were rushed to Government Rajaji Hospital here. However, Kalaivani succumbed to her burns on Tuesday morning.

Usilampatti Town police have registered a case.

In a freak accident, an 18-month-old baby was killed when a television set fell on her in her grandmother’s house in Panniyan.

Police said that P. Vinod (25) of Kodikulam had left his daughter Vishali at his in-laws place in Panniyan on Thursday. The girl who was playing in the house shook the stand on which the television set was kept.

Suddenly, the television set fell on the girl inflicting a head injury on her. She was rushed to Government Rajaji Hospital here where she was given treatment.

However, the girl succumbed to her injuries on Monday.

Chekkanoorani police are investigating.
title: Baby among two killed
